value.0:
When you peer into this smooth orb, all you can see is gray mist. Once you turn to look elsewhere, you catch a glimpse of a white skull in purple smoke, or possibly the figure of a mask, in the corner of your eye. Other times, you could swear something glitters inside the orb. If you look again, however, there’s nothing there.

The common adventurer is completely oblivious to the origin of these orbs, and they’re a mystery even to the greatest sages. They're often said to be crafted by thieves' guilds in the south, or to be sacred items belonging to the clergy of Cyric. Some have even heard rumours claiming them to be the trapped fragments of an ancient god, and the one who gathers them together ascends to divinity.

The most determined seekers might come across a few scholars' claims suggesting the involvement of the Guardian of Liars. Should anyone ask the remaining worshippers of Leira, however, they’d hear the same old stories about dead gods, Mask's thieves, and a few new ones. Whatever the truth, the orb you hold now is clearly a potent magical item, especially for those who want to learn a secret or two - and twist them some before passing on the information, perhaps.
